case_title: MIR HASSAN vs MASTER HAMMAD through his next friend and another
respondents: Master Hammad through his next friend
issues_fractured: Whether the driver was rash and negligent in driving the vehicle
Whether the appellant and respondent No. 2 are liable for damages and compensation

medical_treatment: Emergency treatment at Jinnah Post Medical Centre
Critical care at A.O. Clinic Nazimabad
facts.disability: Permanent disability due to traumatic injuries

judgment.liability: Joint and several liability of appellant and respondent No. 2

appellant.claim: Accident was not due to rash and negligent driving
appellant.evidence: No eye-witnesses or original documents produced
appellant.speed: Vehicle was being driven at low speed

respondent.evidence: Coach dragged the minor for about 200 yards
respondent.burden_of_proof: Appellant failed to prove reasonable care

legal_references.case: Federation of Pakistan v. Hafiza Malika Khatoon Begum
legal_references.principle: Contributory negligence must be proved by the alleging party

legal_references.case: Pakistan Steel Mills Corporation Ltd. Karachi v. Ehteshamuddin Qureshi
legal_references.principle: Drivers of heavy vehicles must take extra care

legal_references.case: Punjab Road Transport Board v. Abdul Wahid Usmani
legal_references.principle: Negligent drivers cannot rely on contributory negligence to avoid liability

legal_references.case: Amul Ramchandra Gandhi v. Abhasbhai Kasambhai Diwan
legal_references.principle: Children cannot be held to the same standard of care as adults

remarks.jurisprudence: Compensation for motor accidents should move towards no-fault liability
remarks.recommendation: Government should legislate to ensure immediate compensation for victims
